akn:content.akn:p: The term “judge” means any judge of the District of Columbia Court of Appeals or the Superior Court or any person with judicial service as described in paragraph (2) of this section.

The term “judicial service” means service as a judge in the District of Columbia Court of Appeals, the Superior Court, or the former Juvenile Court of the District of Columbia, District of Columbia Tax Court, police court, municipal court, Municipal Court of Appeals, or District of Columbia Court of General Sessions.
The terms “retire” and “retirement” include retirement, resignation, or failure to be recommissioned or reappointed upon the expiration of a commission.
The term “fund” means the District of Columbia Judicial Retirement and Survivors Annuity Fund established by section 11-1570.

The term “widow” means a surviving wife of a judge who either (A) has been married to the judge for at least two years preceding his death or (B) is the mother of issue by the marriage and has not remarried.

The term “widower” means a surviving husband of a judge who either (A) has been married to the judge for at least two years preceding her death or (B) is the father of issue by the marriage and has not remarried.
The term “Commissioner” [“Mayor”] means the Commissioner [Mayor] of the District of Columbia.
The term “lump-sum credit for retirement” means the unrefunded amount consisting of —
The term “lump-sum credit for survivor annuity” means the unrefunded amount consisting of —
